top_categories.workout_context: Scratch Ankle Gravel's Florida panhandle gravel rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Scratch Ankle Gravel's Florida panhandle, Southern gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 45 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Scratch Ankle Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before March.
When someone attacks on Florida panhandle gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
45 miles on Florida panhandle gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
At Scratch Ankle Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Scratch Ankle Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Scratch Ankle Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Base fitness for Scratch Ankle Gravel. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Varied gradients on Florida panhandle gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
2-minute all-out efforts on Florida panhandle gravel. Closing gaps, responding to attacks, sprinting for position. Train the burn.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Scratch Ankle Gravel’s 45 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 45 miles of florida panhandle gravel in Milton, FL.
